arm_group.description: Patients will be contacted by phone for administration of the checklist
Patients who will not be contacted by phone

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the impact of a check list on the rate of late
      cancellation, i.e. the day before or the day of the ambulatory surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of a Checklist on the Rate of Late Cancellation in Ambulatory Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
The checklist is administered to the patients by phone between 7 and 3 days before the
      surgery. Each item of the checklist is associated with a decisional algorithm that allows
      take care for patients in case of any problem.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient (adult or minor) for which ambulatory surgery is programmed in a multipurpose
             ASU

          -  Surgery under general anesthesia or loco

          -  Regional or neuroleptanalgesia3. Patient contacted by phone

          -  Patient does not oppose his participation in the study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient programmed for endoscopy in ASU non surgical

          -  Ambulatory surgery scheduled for orthogenic

          -  Ambulatory surgery scheduled for urgency

          -  Ambulatory surgery performed under local anesthesia

intervention.description: he checklist will be administered to the patients by phone between 7 and 3 days before the surgery

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of a Checklist on the Rate of Late Cancellation in Ambulatory Surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in the rate of late cancellation
primary_outcome.time_frame: At  day 0 (the day of the surgery)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement of the organization of the ambulatory unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At day 0 (the day of the surgery)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
